content.description:
Because of the areas significant geological features, the Pinnacles land area is designated a state natural area. Natural areas have special rules so respect and observe all signs, postings, and other users. 50 ft limestone cliffs drop sharply down both sides forming a narrow ridge trail that requires great balance while hiking. Steep climbing trails lead up the sides of the rock and a cool stream flows at the formations base. Steep hiking and technical climbing are differentiated by the use of safety equipment, like ropes. Steep hiking is allowed. Need I say more? 

  The area is managed by the foundations board of directors. Donations are desired. Group reservation are available for youth camping groups. University of Missouri Extension of Boone County, 573-445-9792
